segment.source: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image
segment.target: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image

segment.source: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image
segment.target: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image

segment.source: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image
segment.target: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image

segment.source: You can use the SecWimTool to create a secure WIM image that can be used to service retail devices.
segment.target: You can use the SecWimTool to create a secure WIM image that can be used to service retail devices.

segment.source: Before you can create a secure WIM, you must first create the WIM image itself.
segment.target: Before you can create a secure WIM, you must first create the WIM image itself.

segment.source: For info about how to create a WIM image, see Working with WIM MMOS images.
segment.target: For info about how to create a WIM image, see Working with WIM MMOS images.

segment.source: To use the MMOS WIM in retail, it will need to be signed using retail certificates.
segment.target: To use the MMOS WIM in retail, it will need to be signed using retail certificates.

segment.source: More info will be provided in a later release of this documentation about how to work with the retail images.
segment.target: More info will be provided in a later release of this documentation about how to work with the retail images.

segment.source: For the secure WIM to run on the device, the signing certificates must match the certificates in the Platform Key (PK) that is provisioned on the device.
segment.target: For the secure WIM to run on the device, the signing certificates must match the certificates in the Platform Key (PK) that is provisioned on the device.

segment.source: Installing the needed certificates on the phone
segment.target: Installing the needed certificates on the phone

segment.source: Before you run the tools, you must first provision the appropriate certificates on the device.
segment.target: Before you run the tools, you must first provision the appropriate certificates on the device.

segment.source: To become familiar with SecWimTool, partners can use the secure boot test tool to provision test (non-retail) certificates on the device.
segment.target: To become familiar with SecWimTool, partners can use the secure boot test tool to provision test (non-retail) certificates on the device.

segment.source: Use the secure boot retail tool for retail device.
segment.target: Use the secure boot retail tool for retail device.

segment.source: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image
segment.target: Creating a secure MMOS WIM image

segment.source: To create a secure wim image, complete the following steps.
segment.target: To create a secure wim image, complete the following steps.

segment.source: Open an elevated developer prompt in the directory that contains the output from the ImgToWim image generation process.
segment.target: Open an elevated developer prompt in the directory that contains the output from the ImgToWim image generation process.

segment.source: For info about how to create a WIM image, see Working with WIM MMOS images.
segment.target: For info about how to create a WIM image, see Working with WIM MMOS images.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The image generation executables are located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.
segment.target: The image generation executables are located in %WPDKCONTENTROOT%Toolsbini386.

segment.source: You can use the command to add that path to your environment.
segment.target: You can use the command to add that path to your environment.

segment.source: The platform ID must be used to create the WIM for a specific platform.
segment.target: The platform ID must be used to create the WIM for a specific platform.

segment.source: The platform ID is set in using a device platform XML file.
segment.target: The platform ID is set in using a device platform XML file.

segment.source: You can display the platform ID using the ffutool command with the –list option.
segment.target: You can display the platform ID using the ffutool command with the –list option.

segment.source: Build the unsigned secure WIM targeted for a specific platform using the –platform command option as shown here.
segment.target: Build the unsigned secure WIM targeted for a specific platform using the –platform command option as shown here.

segment.source: No output is returned if the command completes successfully.
segment.target: No output is returned if the command completes successfully.

segment.source: Extract the catalog from the secure WIM image.
segment.target: Extract the catalog from the secure WIM image.

segment.source: No output is returned if the command completes successfully.
segment.target: No output is returned if the command completes successfully.

segment.source: You can sign the WIM with test certificates to test the WIM process.
segment.target: You can sign the WIM with test certificates to test the WIM process.

segment.source: For a retail secure WIM, the FFU must be signed by Microsoft.
segment.target: For a retail secure WIM, the FFU must be signed by Microsoft.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Information about signing with the final retail certificates will be provided in a later release of the documentation.
segment.target: Information about signing with the final retail certificates will be provided in a later release of the documentation.

segment.source: To sign the catalog using the test image certificate, use this command.
segment.target: To sign the catalog using the test image certificate, use this command.

segment.source: This command will generate output that is similar to the following.
segment.target: This command will generate output that is similar to the following.

segment.source: Replace the existing catalog with a signed catalog.
segment.target: Replace the existing catalog with a signed catalog.

segment.source: No output is returned if the command completes successfully.
segment.target: No output is returned if the command completes successfully.

segment.source: Place the device in flashing mode.
segment.target: Place the device in flashing mode.

segment.source: Flash the WIM to the device to test it using the FFUTool.
segment.target: Flash the WIM to the device to test it using the FFUTool.

segment.source: The command will generate output that is similar to the following.
segment.target: The command will generate output that is similar to the following.

segment.source: Working with serial numbers
segment.target: Working with serial numbers

segment.source: The serial number option can be used when including tools that should only be used for a specific device.
segment.target: The serial number option can be used when including tools that should only be used for a specific device.

segment.source: Serial Number- The serial number is a unique ID for the phone that is generated automatically.
segment.target: Serial Number- The serial number is a unique ID for the phone that is generated automatically.

segment.source: You can display the serial number using the ffutool command with the –serial option.
segment.target: You can display the serial number using the ffutool command with the –serial option.

segment.source: To build a secure WIM targeted for a specific device, use the –serial command option as shown here.
segment.target: To build a secure WIM targeted for a specific device, use the –serial command option as shown here.

segment.source: Troubleshooting
segment.target: Troubleshooting

segment.source: When you flash the image if the PK doesn’t match, you will receive this message.
segment.target: When you flash the image if the PK doesn’t match, you will receive this message.

segment.source: SecWimTool command line reference
segment.target: SecWimTool command line reference

segment.source: The following summarizes the command syntax and the four command-line options for SecWimTool.
segment.target: The following summarizes the command syntax and the four command-line options for SecWimTool.

segment.source: -build - Packs the specified WIM into a secwim that is suitable for signing and transferring to a retail device.
segment.target: -build - Packs the specified WIM into a secwim that is suitable for signing and transferring to a retail device.

segment.source: Platform - Includes targeting information for a specific platform type that the WIM is intended for.
segment.target: Platform - Includes targeting information for a specific platform type that the WIM is intended for.

segment.source: This option must be used to target the WIM for a specific platform.
segment.target: This option must be used to target the WIM for a specific platform.

segment.source: Serial - Includes the serial number of a specific device the WIM will be used on.
segment.target: Serial - Includes the serial number of a specific device the WIM will be used on.

segment.source: This option can be used when including tools that should only be used for a specific device.
segment.target: This option can be used when including tools that should only be used for a specific device.

segment.source: -extractcat - Retrieves the catalog from the secure WIM file, and writes it either to the output file (if specified) or stdout.
segment.target: -extractcat - Retrieves the catalog from the secure WIM file, and writes it either to the output file (if specified) or stdout.

segment.source: -replacecat - Replaces the catalog in the specified .secwim with the contents of the new catalog.
segment.target: -replacecat - Replaces the catalog in the specified .secwim with the contents of the new catalog.

segment.source: - Displays command line help.
segment.target: - Displays command line help.

segment.source: Use for command level help.
segment.target: Use for command level help.
